medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced vague abdominal discomfort, malaise, and loose, non-bloody stools that started two weeks ago. The diarrhea subsided after 24 hours, but the abdominal discomfort persisted. Pain became severe and localized to the right lower quadrant three days prior to presentation, now described as stabbing and continuous, worsened with movement, improved with Tylenol, with intermittent diarrhea, low-grade fevers, chills, and anorexia.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for prostate cancer in father, breast cancer in cousin, pancreatic cancer in grandfather.
